April 24, 1923
My dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
Upon my return to New York this week, I find
your letter of April 18 reporting upon the time your
father has spent so far this year on the history of yellow
fever; also the correspondence concerning the statement of
incidental expenses. I am sorry that your father felt it
necessary to correct the original statement. The bill has
been approved, however, and a check will be forwarded from
the Comptroller's office. I am asking Mr. Kirk to send
also a check to cover compensation for your father's work
during the first three months of 1923.
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, F F Russell Miss Laura Armistead Carter
2121 California Street, N.W.
Washington, D.C.
